00028 //========================================================================
00029 //  Content References in Game Coding Complete 2nd Edition

00031 
00032 
00034 // Description:
00035 //
00036 // There are two alpha blending surface copy functions:
00037 // One uses an alpha value for the whole surface, the other uses another surface 
00038 // as an alpha mask.
00039 //
00041 
00042 //========================================================================
00043 //  Content References in Game Coding Complete
00044 // 
00045 //  CopyAlpha                                           - Chapter 10, page 305
00046 //========================================================================
00047 
00048 #include "GameCodeStd.h"
00049 #include <ddraw.h>
00050 
00051 HRESULT CopyAlpha(      const LPDIRECTDRAWSURFACE dest, 
00052                                         const LPDIRECTDRAWSURFACE src, 
00053                                         const unsigned char alpha, 
00054                                         CPoint const * const destPoint,  
00055                                         CRect const * const srcRect,
00056                                         const bool isColorKeyed )
00057 {
00058         HRESULT hr = DDERR_UNSUPPORTED;
00059 
00060         // Check if it is colorKeyed
00061         int colorKey = 0;
00062         if ( isColorKeyed )
00063         {
00064                 DDCOLORKEY ddck;
00065             src->GetColorKey( DDCKEY_SRCBLT, &ddck );
00066                 colorKey = ddck.dwColorSpaceLowValue;
00067         }
00068 
00069         //Prepare the surface descriptors
00070         DDSURFACEDESC sdSrc, sdDest;
00071 
00072         // Lock the source and obtain its descriptor
00073         ZeroMemory( &sdSrc, sizeof( sdSrc ) );
00074         sdSrc.dwSize = sizeof( sdSrc );
00075 
00076         hr = src->Lock( NULL, &sdSrc, DDLOCK_WAIT, NULL );
00077         if ( (hr != DD_OK) )
00078         {
00079                 //assert ( 0 && "Failed to lock" );
00080                 return hr;
00081         }
00082 
00083         // Lock the source and obtain its descriptor
00084         ZeroMemory( &sdDest, sizeof( sdDest ) );
00085         sdDest.dwSize = sizeof( sdDest );
00086 
00087         hr = dest->Lock( NULL, &sdDest, DDLOCK_WAIT, NULL );
00088         if ( (hr != DD_OK) )
00089         {
00090                 //assert ( 0 && "Failed to lock" );
00091                 src->Unlock( NULL );
00092                 return hr;
00093         }
00094 
00095         // Note: 
00096         // Alpha blitting requires that both the source and destination exist in system memory, not video
00097         // It will freeze windows 98 machines and slow down win2K machines if a source or destination
00098         // live in video memory
00099 
00100         if ( (sdSrc.ddpfPixelFormat.dwRGBBitCount!=sdDest.ddpfPixelFormat.dwRGBBitCount) ||
00101                  (sdSrc.ddpfPixelFormat.dwRBitMask!=sdDest.ddpfPixelFormat.dwRBitMask) ||
00102                  (sdSrc.ddpfPixelFormat.dwGBitMask!=sdDest.ddpfPixelFormat.dwGBitMask) ||
00103                  (sdSrc.ddpfPixelFormat.dwBBitMask!=sdDest.ddpfPixelFormat.dwBBitMask) )
00104         {
00105                 assert (false && "wrong mode");
00106                 src->Unlock( NULL );
00107                 dest->Unlock( NULL );
00108                 return DDERR_WRONGMODE;
00109         }
00110 
00111         // Grab the mask values
00112         const unsigned int REDMASK = sdSrc.ddpfPixelFormat.dwRBitMask;
00113         const unsigned int GREENMASK = sdSrc.ddpfPixelFormat.dwGBitMask;
00114         const unsigned int BLUEMASK = sdSrc.ddpfPixelFormat.dwBBitMask;
00115         
00116         // Determine how to blend based on source RGBBitCount
00117         switch( sdSrc.ddpfPixelFormat.dwRGBBitCount )
00118         {
00119 
00120         // 16 bit blend
00121         case 16 :
00122         {
00123                 const int iSrcWidth = sdSrc.lPitch / sizeof( short unsigned int );
00124                 const int iDstWidth = sdDest.lPitch / sizeof( short unsigned int );
00125                 //It will be assumed that the alpha surface shares the same dimensions as the source
00126                 short unsigned int * lpSrc = &((short unsigned int *)sdSrc.lpSurface)[ srcRect->left + srcRect->top * iSrcWidth ];
00127                 short unsigned int * lpDest = &((short unsigned int *)sdDest.lpSurface)[ destPoint->x + destPoint->y * iDstWidth ];
00128 
00129                 int rectH = srcRect->bottom - srcRect->top;
00130                 int rectW = srcRect->right - srcRect->left;
00131                 const int sskip = iSrcWidth - rectW;
00132                 const int dskip = iDstWidth - rectW;
00133 
00134                 int x,y;
00135                 unsigned int rs,gs,bs;  //source pixel components
00136                 unsigned int rd,gd,bd;  //destination pixel components
00137                 unsigned int rd2,gd2,bd2;       //destination pixel components used to avoid stalling due to read-write conflict
00138                 for(y=0; y<rectH; y++)
00139                 {
00140                         for(x=0; x<rectW; x++, lpDest++, lpSrc++)
00141                         {
00142                                 if ( colorKey && (*lpSrc)==(short unsigned int)colorKey )
00143                                 {
00144                                         continue;
00145                                 }
00146 
00147                                 if(0xFF == alpha)//full intensity, nothing but source will show
00148                                 {
00149                                         *lpDest = *lpSrc;
00150                                         continue;
00151                                 }
00152                                 else if(0 == alpha)//no intensity, background all the way
00153                                 {
00154                                         continue;
00155                                 }
00156 
00157                                 rd = (*lpDest & REDMASK); 
00158                                 gd = (*lpDest & GREENMASK); 
00159                                 bd = (*lpDest & BLUEMASK);
00160 
00161                                 rs = (*lpSrc & REDMASK);
00162                                 gs = (*lpSrc & GREENMASK);
00163                                 bs = (*lpSrc & BLUEMASK);
00164 
00165                                 rd2 = rd + ((alpha*(rs-rd))>>8);
00166                                 gd2 = gd + ((alpha*(gs-gd))>>8);
00167                                 bd2 = bd + ((alpha*(bs-bd))>>8);
00168 
00169                                 rd2 &= REDMASK;
00170                                 gd2 &= GREENMASK;
00171                                 bd2 &= BLUEMASK;
00172 
00173                                 *lpDest = rd2 | gd2 | bd2;
00174                         }
00175 
00176                         lpDest += dskip;
00177                         lpSrc += sskip;
00178                 }
00179 
00180                 hr = DD_OK;
00181         }
00182         break;
00183 
00184         // 32 bit blend
00185         case 32 :
00186         {
00187                 const int iSrcWidth = sdSrc.lPitch / sizeof( unsigned int );
00188                 const int iDstWidth = sdDest.lPitch / sizeof( unsigned int );
00189                 //It will be assumed that the alpha surface shares the same dimensions as the source
00190                 unsigned int * lpSrc = &((unsigned int *)sdSrc.lpSurface)[ srcRect->left + srcRect->top * iSrcWidth ];
00191                 unsigned int * lpDest = &((unsigned int *)sdDest.lpSurface)[ destPoint->x + destPoint->y * iDstWidth ];
00192 
00193                 int rectH = srcRect->bottom - srcRect->top;
00194                 int rectW = srcRect->right - srcRect->left;
00195                 const int sskip = iSrcWidth - rectW;
00196                 const int dskip = iDstWidth - rectW;
00197 
00198                 int x,y;
00199                 unsigned int rs,gs,bs;  //source pixel components
00200                 unsigned int rd,gd,bd;  //destination pixel components
00201                 unsigned int rd2,gd2,bd2;       //destination pixel components used to avoid stalling due to read-write conflict
00202                 for(y=0; y<rectH; y++)
00203                 {
00204                         for(x=0; x<rectW; x++, lpDest++, lpSrc++)
00205                         {
00206                                 if (colorKey && (*lpSrc)==(unsigned int)colorKey)
00207                                 {
00208                                         continue;
00209                                 }
00210 
00211                                 if(0xFF == alpha)//full intensity, nothing but source will show
00212                                 {
00213                                         *lpDest = *lpSrc;
00214                                         continue;
00215                                 }
00216                                 else if(0 == alpha)//no intensity, background all the way
00217                                 {
00218                                         continue;
00219                                 }
00220 
00221                                 rd = (*lpDest & REDMASK); 
00222                                 gd = (*lpDest & GREENMASK); 
00223                                 bd = (*lpDest & BLUEMASK);
00224 
00225                                 rs = (*lpSrc & REDMASK);
00226                                 gs = (*lpSrc & GREENMASK);
00227                                 bs = (*lpSrc & BLUEMASK);
00228 
00229                                 rd2 = rd + ((alpha*(rs-rd))>>8);
00230                                 gd2 = gd + ((alpha*(gs-gd))>>8);
00231                                 bd2 = bd + ((alpha*(bs-bd))>>8);
00232 
00233                                 rd2 &= REDMASK;
00234                                 gd2 &= GREENMASK;
00235                                 bd2 &= BLUEMASK;
00236 
00237                                 *lpDest = rd2 | gd2 | bd2;
00238                         }
00239 
00240                         lpDest += dskip;
00241                         lpSrc += sskip;
00242                 }
00243 
00244                 hr = DD_OK;
00245         }
00246         break;
00247 
00248         // no alpha blending on palettized surface
00249         case 8 :
00250         // unsupported
00251         default :
00252                 hr = S_FALSE;
00253                 break;
00254         }
00255 
00256         // Cleanup
00257         src->Unlock( NULL );
00258         dest->Unlock( NULL );
00259 
00260         return hr;
00261 }//end CopyAlpha
00262 
00263 
00264 HRESULT CopyAlpha(      const LPDIRECTDRAWSURFACE7 dest, 
00265                                         const LPDIRECTDRAWSURFACE7 src, 
00266                                         const LPDIRECTDRAWSURFACE7 alpha, 
00267                                         CPoint const * const destPoint,  
00268                                         CRect const * const srcRect,
00269                                         const bool isColorKeyed )
00270 {
00271         assert(alpha && "CopyAlpha assumes you have an alpha surface");
00272 
00273         HRESULT hr = DDERR_UNSUPPORTED;
00274 
00275         // Check if it is colorKeyed
00276         int colorKey = 0;
00277         if ( isColorKeyed )
00278         {
00279                 DDCOLORKEY ddck;
00280             src->GetColorKey( DDCKEY_SRCBLT, &ddck );
00281                 colorKey = ddck.dwColorSpaceLowValue;
00282         }
00283 
00284         //Prepare the surface descriptors
00285         DDSURFACEDESC2 sdSrc, sdDest, sdAlpha;
00286 
00287         // Lock the source and obtain its descriptor
00288         ZeroMemory( &sdSrc, sizeof( sdSrc ) );
00289         sdSrc.dwSize = sizeof( sdSrc );
00290 
00291         hr = src->Lock( NULL, &sdSrc, DDLOCK_WAIT, NULL );
00292         if ( (hr != DD_OK) )
00293         {
00294                 //assert ( 0 && "Failed to lock" );
00295                 return hr;
00296         }
00297 
00298         // Lock the source and obtain its descriptor
00299         ZeroMemory( &sdDest, sizeof( sdDest ) );
00300         sdDest.dwSize = sizeof( sdDest );
00301 
00302         hr = dest->Lock( NULL, &sdDest, DDLOCK_WAIT, NULL );
00303         if ( (hr != DD_OK) )
00304         {
00305                 //assert ( 0 && "Failed to lock" );
00306                 src->Unlock( NULL );
00307                 return hr;
00308         }
00309 
00310         // Lock the source and obtain its descriptor
00311         ZeroMemory( &sdAlpha, sizeof( sdAlpha ) );
00312         sdAlpha.dwSize = sizeof( sdAlpha );
00313 
00314         hr = alpha->Lock( NULL, &sdAlpha, DDLOCK_WAIT, NULL );
00315         if ( hr != DD_OK )
00316         {
00317                 //assert ( 0 && "Failed to lock" );
00318                 src->Unlock( NULL );
00319                 dest->Unlock( NULL );
00320                 return hr;
00321         }
00322 
00323 
00324         // Note: 
00325         // Alpha blitting requires that both the source and destination exist in system memory, not video
00326         // It will freeze windows 98 machines and slow down win2K machines if a source or destination
00327         // live in video memory
00328 
00329         if ( (sdSrc.ddpfPixelFormat.dwRGBBitCount!=sdDest.ddpfPixelFormat.dwRGBBitCount) ||
00330                  (sdSrc.ddpfPixelFormat.dwRBitMask!=sdDest.ddpfPixelFormat.dwRBitMask) ||
00331                  (sdSrc.ddpfPixelFormat.dwGBitMask!=sdDest.ddpfPixelFormat.dwGBitMask) ||
00332                  (sdSrc.ddpfPixelFormat.dwBBitMask!=sdDest.ddpfPixelFormat.dwBBitMask) )
00333         {
00334                 assert (false && "wrong mode");
00335                 src->Unlock( NULL );
00336                 dest->Unlock( NULL );
00337                 alpha->Unlock( NULL );
00338                 return DDERR_WRONGMODE;
00339         }
00340 
00341         // Grab the mask values
00342         const unsigned int REDMASK = sdSrc.ddpfPixelFormat.dwRBitMask;
00343         const unsigned int GREENMASK = sdSrc.ddpfPixelFormat.dwGBitMask;
00344         const unsigned int BLUEMASK = sdSrc.ddpfPixelFormat.dwBBitMask;
00345         
00346         // Determine how to blend based on source RGBBitCount
00347         switch( sdSrc.ddpfPixelFormat.dwRGBBitCount )
00348         {
00349 
00350         // 16 bit blend
00351         case 16 :
00352         {
00353                 const int iSrcWidth = sdSrc.lPitch / sizeof( short unsigned int );
00354                 const int iDstWidth = sdDest.lPitch / sizeof( short unsigned int );
00355                 //It will be assumed that the alpha surface shares the same dimensions as the source
00356                 short unsigned int * lpAlpha = &((short unsigned int *)sdAlpha.lpSurface)[ srcRect->left + srcRect->top * iSrcWidth ];
00357                 short unsigned int * lpSrc = &((short unsigned int *)sdSrc.lpSurface)[ srcRect->left + srcRect->top * iSrcWidth ];
00358                 short unsigned int * lpDest = &((short unsigned int *)sdDest.lpSurface)[ destPoint->x + destPoint->y * iDstWidth ];
00359                 assert(sdSrc.lPitch == sdAlpha.lPitch && "It is assumed that the alpha mask will have the same dimensions as the source sprite");
00360 
00361                 int rectH = srcRect->bottom - srcRect->top;
00362                 int rectW = srcRect->right - srcRect->left;
00363                 const int sskip = iSrcWidth - rectW;
00364                 const int dskip = iDstWidth - rectW;
00365 
00366                 int x,y;
00367                 unsigned int alpha;     //alpha pixel component
00368                 unsigned int rs,gs,bs;  //source pixel components
00369                 unsigned int rd,gd,bd;  //destination pixel components
00370                 unsigned int rd2,gd2,bd2;       //destination pixel components used to avoid stalling due to read-write conflict
00371                 for(y=0; y<rectH; y++)
00372                 {
00373                         for(x=0; x<rectW; x++, lpDest++, lpSrc++, lpAlpha++)
00374                         {
00375                                 if ( colorKey && (*lpSrc)==(short unsigned int)colorKey )
00376                                 {
00377                                         continue;
00378                                 }
00379 
00380                                 //Alpha channel will be based on the blue intensity because reading blue requires no shifting
00381                                 alpha = *lpAlpha & BLUEMASK;
00382                                 if(BLUEMASK == alpha)//full intensity, nothing but source will show
00383                                 {
00384                                         *lpDest = *lpSrc;
00385                                         continue;
00386                                 }
00387                                 else if(0 == alpha)//no intensity, background all the way
00388                                 {
00389                                         continue;
00390                                 }
00391 
00392                                 rd = (*lpDest & REDMASK); 
00393                                 gd = (*lpDest & GREENMASK); 
00394                                 bd = (*lpDest & BLUEMASK);
00395 
00396                                 rs = (*lpSrc & REDMASK);
00397                                 gs = (*lpSrc & GREENMASK);
00398                                 bs = (*lpSrc & BLUEMASK);
00399 
00400                                 rd2 = rd + ((alpha*(rs-rd))>>5);
00401                                 gd2 = gd + ((alpha*(gs-gd))>>5);
00402                                 bd2 = bd + ((alpha*(bs-bd))>>5);
00403 
00404                                 rd2 &= REDMASK;
00405                                 gd2 &= GREENMASK;
00406                                 bd2 &= BLUEMASK;
00407 
00408                                 *lpDest = rd2 | gd2 | bd2;
00409                         }
00410 
00411                         lpDest += dskip;
00412                         lpSrc += sskip;
00413                         lpAlpha += sskip;
00414                 }
00415 
00416                 hr = DD_OK;
00417         }
00418         break;
00419 
00420         // 32 bit blend
00421         case 32 :
00422         {
00423                 const int iSrcWidth = sdSrc.lPitch / sizeof( unsigned int );
00424                 const int iDstWidth = sdDest.lPitch / sizeof( unsigned int );
00425                 //It will be assumed that the alpha surface shares the same dimensions as the source
00426                 unsigned int * lpAlpha = &((unsigned int *)sdAlpha.lpSurface)[ srcRect->left + srcRect->top * iSrcWidth ];
00427                 unsigned int * lpSrc = &((unsigned int *)sdSrc.lpSurface)[ srcRect->left + srcRect->top * iSrcWidth ];
00428                 unsigned int * lpDest = &((unsigned int *)sdDest.lpSurface)[ destPoint->x + destPoint->y * iDstWidth ];
00429 
00430                 assert(sdSrc.lPitch == sdAlpha.lPitch && "It is assumed that the alpha mask will have the same dimensions as the source sprite");
00431 
00432                 int rectH = srcRect->bottom - srcRect->top;
00433                 int rectW = srcRect->right - srcRect->left;
00434                 const int sskip = iSrcWidth - rectW;
00435                 const int dskip = iDstWidth - rectW;
00436 
00437                 int x,y;
00438                 unsigned int alpha;     //alpha pixel component
00439                 unsigned int rs,gs,bs;  //source pixel components
00440                 unsigned int rd,gd,bd;  //destination pixel components
00441                 unsigned int rd2,gd2,bd2;       //destination pixel components used to avoid stalling due to read-write conflict
00442                 for(y=0; y<rectH; y++)
00443                 {
00444                         for(x=0; x<rectW; x++, lpDest++, lpSrc++, lpAlpha++)
00445                         {
00446                                 if (colorKey && (*lpSrc)==(unsigned int)colorKey)
00447                                 {
00448                                         continue;
00449                                 }
00450 
00451                                 //Alpha channel will be based on the blue intensity because reading blue requires no shifting
00452                                 alpha = *lpAlpha & BLUEMASK;
00453                                 if(BLUEMASK == alpha)//full intensity, nothing but source will show
00454                                 {
00455                                         *lpDest = *lpSrc;
00456                                         continue;
00457                                 }
00458                                 else if(0 == alpha)//no intensity, background all the way
00459                                 {
00460                                         continue;
00461                                 }
00462 
00463                                 rd = (*lpDest & REDMASK); 
00464                                 gd = (*lpDest & GREENMASK); 
00465                                 bd = (*lpDest & BLUEMASK);
00466 
00467                                 rs = (*lpSrc & REDMASK);
00468                                 gs = (*lpSrc & GREENMASK);
00469                                 bs = (*lpSrc & BLUEMASK);
00470 
00471                                 rd2 = rd + ((alpha*(rs-rd))>>8);
00472                                 gd2 = gd + ((alpha*(gs-gd))>>8);
00473                                 bd2 = bd + ((alpha*(bs-bd))>>8);
00474 
00475                                 rd2 &= REDMASK;
00476                                 gd2 &= GREENMASK;
00477                                 bd2 &= BLUEMASK;
00478 
00479                                 *lpDest = rd2 | gd2 | bd2;
00480                         }
00481 
00482                         lpDest += dskip;
00483                         lpSrc += sskip;
00484                         lpAlpha += sskip;
00485                 }
00486 
00487                 hr = DD_OK;
00488         }
00489         break;
00490 
00491         // no alpha blending on palettized surface
00492         case 8 :
00493         // unsupported
00494         default :
00495                 hr = S_FALSE;
00496                 break;
00497         }
00498 
00499         // Cleanup
00500         src->Unlock( NULL );
00501         dest->Unlock( NULL );
00502         alpha->Unlock( NULL );
00503 
00504         return hr;
00505 }//end CopyAlpha
